definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: The driver hastens next handlebar grandpa uprear, apologize again and again.
sentences.chinese: 司機趕忙下車把老大爺扶起，並連連道歉。

sentences.english: Sometimes a few old man to get on the car, we all rob the seats.
sentences.chinese: 不時有幾個老大爺上車，我們大家都搶着讓座。

sentences.english: Just then an old man entered, supported by a boy.
sentences.chinese: 就在這時候，一個男孩攙着一位老大爺走了進來。

sentences.english: The young man gave up his seat to an old man.
sentences.chinese: 那年青人將座位讓給一位老大爺。

sentences.english: After attending evening classes Grandpa became more open-minded.
sentences.chinese: 老大爺上夜校以後，腦筋更開通了。

sentences.english: Grandpa, can I have a drink?
sentences.chinese: 老大爺，能給我口水喝麼？

sentences.english: There is an old man under that tree.
Be those old men walking across the street?
sentences.chinese: 那些老大爺在橫過馬路嗎？

sentences.english: This old man has an eye for curios.
sentences.chinese: 這個老大爺有辨別古董的眼力。

sentences.english: It serves as a prerequisite for Reapers to be built at the Barracks.
sentences.chinese: 兵營是雙槍老大爺的前提建築之一。

sentences.english: The old man often goes to the teahouse to drink tea .
sentences.chinese: 那位老大爺經常到茶館裏喝茶。

sentences.english: A group of children surrounded the old man.
sentences.chinese: 一羣孩子把老大爺圍住了。

sentences.english: You get your hands well, old man.
sentences.chinese: 你把你的手養好，老大爺。
